chart.title: Share of paints with lead levels greater than 600 ppm
chart.subtitle: Lead paint is thought to be a significant contributor to lead poisoning; many countries have therefore implemented a regulatory limit of 90 parts per million (ppm) or 600ppm per weight of dry paint.

share_paints_exceeding_600ppm_lead.titleShort: Share of paints with lead levels exceeding 600 parts per million
share_paints_exceeding_600ppm_lead.titleLong: Share of paints with lead levels exceeding 600 parts per million
share_paints_exceeding_600ppm_lead.citationShort: – processed by Our World in Data
share_paints_exceeding_600ppm_lead.citationLong: – processed by Our World in Data. “Share of paints with lead levels exceeding 600 parts per million” [dataset]. International Pollutants Elimination Network (IPEN) [original data].
